dublin_core.dcvalue: Panel Challenges and Lessons Learned in Neonatal Digital Health Programs Save the Children SC and UNICEF in collaboration with other key humanitarian actors have developed the Newborn Health in Humanitarian Settings Field Guide The presentation focuses on SC s experiences from Bosaso both positive and negative Learn more about how mobile technology and the KoBo Toolkit has supported timely and quality data collection in a hard to reach and challenging context Next learn more about the Open Smart Register OpenSRP platform in the Bangladesh health system The system aims to 1 digitize paper logbooks automate scheduling and streamline the data reporting process 2 Expand the ability of mid level supervisors to monitor field workers byproviding real time performance monitoring 3 Create a more robust system for population registration and surveillance including denominator capture tracking vital events and other key outcomes Presented by Dr Subhash Chandir Director MCH program Interactive Research Development
Made available in DSpace on 2020-06-22T11:11:21Z (GMT). No. of bitstreams: 1 gdhf_chc_gsm_v3.pptx: 6689291 bytes, checksum: 1447ffe71456e5321ef266631e2afce0 (MD5)
Using GSM-based GIS Tracking to Improve Workforce Monitoring
